title: Govt committed to digital integration in mental health services: PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya reaffirmed the government’s commitment to integrating digital health solutions into the country’s existing mental health services, aligning with its broader digitization agenda.

title: Expedite setting up of International Trade office: Harsha
byline: Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance Dr. Harsha de Silva said in Parliament today that setting up of the International Trade Office is an urgent need.

title: Spy cockroaches and AI robots: Germany plots the future of warfare
byline: For Gundbert Scherf - the co-founder of Germany’s Helsing, Europe’s most valuable defence start-up - Russia’s invasion of Ukraine changed everything.

title: Upper Kotmale spillway opens, other reservoirs near overflow
byline: A spill gate of the Upper Kotmale Reservoir has been opened as water levels in the Maussakelle and Castlereagh reservoirs approach overflow levels due to continued heavy rains on the western slopes of the Central Hills, the Nuwara Eliya District Disaster Management Unit said.

title: Thai and Cambodian troops clash at disputed border
byline: Troops from Thailand and Cambodia have clashed at a disputed portion of their border early on Thursday, with both sides accusing each other of firing the first shot.

title: Ravi questions SVAT abolition, warns of export sector risks
byline: UNP MP Ravi Karunanayake yesterday (23) questioned the government’s decision to abolish the Simplified VAT (SVAT) scheme from October 1, 2025, warning that the move could severely affect Sri Lanka’s export sector.

title: Banned ‘Spas’ back in business: Who gave them the license to re-open?
byline: The spas and wellness centers that were shut down earlier for operating as brothels under the guise of Ayurvedic treatment in Negombo, Seeduwa, and Kochchikade have re-opened and resumed their operations, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Abusive language in paper shocks students in Anuradhapura
byline: Teachers have raised serious concerns over a printing error in the scholarship mock examination paper distributed to Grade 5 students in the Anuradhapura education zone on Monday (22), saying it caused significant confusion and distress to both students and teachers.

title: Knuckles Spring Water enters the Bahrain market
byline: Knuckles Spring Water, produced by Sri Lanka’s Cargills (Ceylon) PLC, has officially entered the Bahraini market with the support of the Sri Lankan Embassy in the Kingdom of Bahrain. This marks the first time a Cargills-manufactured product has been introduced to Bahrain.

title: Hrithik Roshan to attend grand opening of City of Dreams
byline: Bollywood superstar Hrithik Roshan is set to visit Sri Lanka for the much-anticipated grand opening of City of Dreams Sri Lanka on August 2, 2025, stepping in as the special guest following the withdrawal of Shah Rukh Khan.

title: Central Bank stays pat on key policy rate as economic indicators move in right direction
byline: The Central Bank left its key policy rate unchanged at its fourth monetary policy announcement yesterday, as Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe said all macroeconomic indicators are moving in the right direction, capturing the sentiments of the Monetary Policy Board, which decided the current policy stance is just about at the right level to accomplish their mandate in maintaining price stability.

title: Bangladesh central bank honours Sri Lankan bank for foiling 2016 cyber heist
byline: Bangladesh’s central bank (Bangladesh Bank) hosted a special award ceremony at its headquarters in Motijheel on 17 July, to formally recognise officials from Sri Lanka’s Pan Asia Banking Corporation PLC for their role in preventing a US$ 20 million fraudulent transaction during the infamous 2016 Bangladesh Bank reserve heist incident.

title: No record of 1988/89 Dalada Maligawa attack: Govt
byline: The government does not possess any records of the 1988/89 attack on the sacred Sri Dalada Maligawa, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala revealed in Parliament today.

title: Current deputy Defence Minister maintained deafening silence on Zahran’s activities as then Eastern Commander: MP
byline: Dropping a bombshell in Parliament, opposition MP Nizam Kariapper today said current Deputy Minister of Defence Aruna Jayasekera who was one time Security Force Commander in the east neglected prior information received on activities of Zahran who led the Easter Sunday attacks since 2015.

title: Women activists’ legal battle ended after lifting ban on women in alcohol industry
byline: A Fundamental Rights petition filed by several women activists and women’s organizations was settled before the Supreme Court following the issuance of a new gazette notification permitting women to purchase liquor from any licensed outlet, work in establishments engaged in liquor production, and consume liquor at retail premises.

title: Government will not reverse gazette on cross border vehicle imports: Minister
byline: Claiming that a clear violation of regulations has occurred in the import of vehicles under cross-border Letters of Credit (LCs), Minister of Labour and Deputy Minister of Economic Development Dr. Anil Jayantha said today the government will not reverse the gazette issued on cross border imports.

title: Court holds back rugby’s caretaker
byline: Western Province Rugby Union wins Enjoining Order against Sports Ministry’s Working Task Force.

title: Vets ready to lead rabies eradication once programme moves to Animal Health dept.
byline: The Government Veterinary Officers’ Association announced that veterinary professionals are prepared to take on the challenge of eradicating rabies in Sri Lanka, following the planned transfer of the National Dog Sterilisation and Rabies Vaccination Programme to the Department of Animal Production and Health (DAPH).

title: Meta expands teen account protections and child safety features
byline: Meta has announced a range of updates to bolster efforts to protect teens from potentially unsafe or unwanted contact and shared new data on the impact of its latest safety tools.

title: CSE Advances Following CBSL’s Decision to Maintain Policy Rate
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange opened positively today following the Central Bank’s decision to keep the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) unchanged at 7.75%. Investor sentiment remained upbeat throughout the session, driving the All Share Price Index (ASPI) up by 151.15 points (+0.79%) to close at 19,243.08, while the S&P SL20 also gained 32.00 points (+0.57%) to settle at 5,689.62.

title: No plans to restrict vehicle imports: Central Bank Governor
byline: Central Bank Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe said that there are no plans to reimpose restrictions on vehicle imports, assuring that the market will remain open.

title: Sri Lanka Has Identified Five Potential Sites For First Nuclear Power Plant
byline: Sri Lanka is making progress in establishing nuclear infrastructure and has already identified potential new-build sites as it embarks on the development of its nuclear power programme, according to an International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) review mission.

title: Sri Lankan migrant worker endures trauma following workplace humiliation in Korea
byline: A Sri Lankan migrant worker said he continues to suffer from trauma months after co-workers tied him to a forklift and mocked him at a brick factory in Naju, South Jeolla, in an incident that has fueled national outrage and triggered a government investigation into the abuse of foreign laborers.

title: Government to decide on Grade 5 scholarship examination in 2029: Deputy Minister
byline: The government will take a decision on the Grade 5 scholarship examination in 2029, Deputy Minister of Education and Higher Education Dr. Madura Seneviratne said today.

title: Sri Lanka to tour England for white-ball series in September
byline: Sri Lanka National Men’s Team will tour England in September 2026 for a white-ball series, the Sri Lanka Cricket said.

title: I have become a social media hit: Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister Mahinda Jayasinghe told Parliament today that he has become a social media hit after going wrong when reciting ‘Lowada Sangarawa’  which is a Sinhala verse, the other day.

title: Get teachers from Tamil Nadu to train local teachers in plantation sector: MP
byline: MP Jeevan Thondaman in Parliament today proposed seeking assistance from Tamil Nadu to train local teachers on STEM education in the plantation sector.

title: Sri Lankans to get seasonal jobs in South Korea
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) says that many seasonal job opportunities in South Korea are now available for Sri Lankans following an agreement between the two governments.

title: Over 500 kilos of bananas wasted daily at Thambuttegama Economic Centre
byline: More than 500 kilos of bananas are wasted every day at the Thambuttegama Economic Centre, Chairman Sunil Seneviratne said.

title: More foreign-trained specialist doctors choosing to stay in Sri Lanka: Health Minister
byline: Health and Mass Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa says more specialist doctors who have completed training abroad are now choosing to stay in Sri Lanka instead of leaving the country.

title: No survivors in Russian passenger plane crash
byline: All 49 people on board the Angara Airlines An-24 passenger plane which crashed in Russia’s far east Amur region have died, TASS news agency reported citing preliminary information from emergency services.

title: Prisoner breaks free at hospital, attacks officer with bottle
byline: A suspect in custody at the Colombo Remand Prison attempted to escape yesterday while being escorted to the psychiatric clinic at the Colombo National Hospital.

title: Rohitha Abeygunawardene’s son-in-law appears in court
byline: The son-in-law of former Minister Rohitha Abeygunawardene appeared before the Mathugama Magistrate’s Court today in connection with an ongoing investigation into an illegal vehicle assembly operation.

title: Rise in rambutan-related accidents
byline: Experts have raised concerns over a growing number of accidents involving people falling from rambutan trees, raising safety concerns during the fruit-picking season, the Health Promotion Bureau said.

title: No child should have to drop out of school: President
byline: An education reform is required to ensure a 13 year continuous education where no student needs to drop out of the school system, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: X-Press Pearl disaster: SC orders non-state parties to pay USD 1 Billion
byline: In a landmark judgment, the Supreme Court today ordered the non-state parties involved in the X-Press Pearl maritime disaster to make an initial payment of USD 1 billion within one year as compensation for the damage caused.

title: Russian plane goes missing with nearly 50 aboard
byline: Air traffic controllers lost contact on Thursday with an An-24 passenger plane carrying about 50 people in Russia’s far east, and a search was under way, the regional governor said.

title: President arrives in Parliament
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived in Parliament a short while ago.

title: More raids launched to seize poachers’ illegal firearms
byline: The Wildlife Conservation Department has intensified its operations to seize illegal firearms used by poachers and individuals targeting wild animals, including elephants.

title: Rohini Kaviratne apologises to Speaker but wants action against Leader of the House
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Rohini Kaviratne tendered an apology today to Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne for asking him to shut his mouth on Wednesday.

title: SJB member elected chairman of Weligama PS
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) member Lasantha Wickramasekara was today elected as the new Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha (PS), following a closely contested vote.

title: Attempted shooting at health official fails in Dehiwala
byline: An attempted shooting targeting a health administration officer near the S. De S. Jayasinghe Stadium in Dehiwala failed this morning.

title: Contempt of court application against Harsha Ilukpitiya postponed for September 23
byline: The contempt of court application filed against former Controller General of Immigration and Emigration Harsha Ilukpitiya has been postponed for September 23 by the Supreme Court.

title: 36,000 cancer patients admitted to Apeksha Hospital within six months: Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Health Dr. Hansaka Wijemuni revealed today that 36,000 cancer patients have been admitted to the Apeksha Hospital, Maharagama within the first six months of this year, from January to June 30, 2025.

title: Namal welcomes Central Bank’s move toward cryptocurrency recognition
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa has expressed support for the Central Bank’s recent initiative to open dialogue on recognizing cryptocurrency as a legitimate transaction method.
